page.title: 04AT HOME IN SANTON DOWNHAM
page.content: Santon Downham has mains electricity but no gas. Water is piped to all the village from a F.C. bore_hole. Some of the houses are connected to the F.C. sewage works which is currently being improved. Most of the housing stock is of 2 storey, 3 bedroom small houses with gardens. Many date to 1920_1930 but new ones are still being built. There are some much older buildings such as Bridge House and the Old Rectory and some, such as Dog Kennel Cottages, which have been converted from buildings on the old feudal estate. About 90% of the housing is owned by the F.C. but some of the tenants have been given the option to buy the houses they occupy.
